Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • Message
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Communication, java.io.Serializable
    public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
implements Communication, java.io.Serializable
    Creates a Message object to encapsulate a text-based message. Can include optional metadata, such as a Date object, a string to represent the sender of the message, and a string to represent the recipient of the message. May consider removing commType as a constructor parameter, as a Message object would only ever have the commType Communication.MESSAGE.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int commType
      The type of communication, in this case, Communication.MESSAGE.
      private java.util.Date date
      The Date object used to allow timestamps for sent/received messages.
      private java.lang.String message
      The text-based message to be sent--the main piece of the Message object
      private java.lang.String recipient
      The name of the recipient of the Message object.
      private java.lang.String sender
      The name of the sender of the Message object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Message

        public Message​(java.lang.String message,
               int commType)
        The default constructor. Encapsulates a textual message and the type of communication in a Message object.
        Parameters:
        message - The textual message to be encapsulated
        commType - The type of communication, in this case, Communication.MESSAGE. May be removed in a future iteration.

      • Message

        public Message​(java.lang.String message,
               java.util.Date date,
               int commType)
        Overloaded constructor. Adds a Date parameter.
        Parameters:
        message - The textual message to be encapsulated
        date - The Date object to allow for timestamps of messages
        commType - The type of communication, in this case, Communication.MESSAGE. May be removed in a future iteration.
